head.supplied: 1/8/95 ¶ ¶ Am not certain, dear Mr Gill, whether among the multitudinous felicitation at my entering the 8th Decade of my life, I did acknowledge in due gratitude also yours. ¶ If in the turmoil of ...

div.p: RB MSS M33, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

MS is accompanied by an envelope: 'On Her Majesty's Service | Walter Gill Esqr F.LS. Conservator of Forests, Adelaide. | Government Botanist, Melbourne, 1/8/1895'. The front bears the frank stamp of the CHIEF SECRETARY VICTORIA and a postal stamp 'MELBOURNE AU 2 95'. 1/8/95

Am not certain, dear Mr Gill, whether among the multitudinous felicitation at my entering the 8th Decade of my life, I did acknowledge in due gratitude also yours.
Letter not found. If in the turmoil of heavy official work all through July I omitted to express my thanks to so genial friend as yourself, you will know that it was not an intentional shortcoming. Let me hope, that far in the next century you will celebrate festively also the reaching of the 3 scores and ten.

A lot of arrear-work, concerning bot. specimens to be named, will now soon be brought up, so also yours after now the enlarged
ninth edition of the Select plants
B95.08.04. is through the press. The Gov. Printing Office provides this book at cost-price, and Ruralists also in S.A. would do well to send for it, as it can always be [sold] for the 5/ it costs. Why does not some Adelaide Bookseller "keep it in stock" I have no
financial interest in the work. If at any time you have fresh seeds of Casuarina Descaisneana to spare think kindly of me!

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Euc Muelleriana (Howitt) seeds were only recently sent out for first time. It is the yellow Stringybark tree of Gippsland
